answers.answer: It's possible that you need to increase the walking a bit or change up your aerobics, some.  My doctor recently recommended that I do weight training.You also need to look at the types of foods you are eating, along with the number of calories.  Make sure you opt for lean protein, whole grains, low/no fat dairy, lots of veggies, etc.

Forgot to mention: many doctors prescribe metformin for PCOS; are you on medication?  Have you had your thyroid levels tested?  Many times, PCOS goes hand in  hand with hypothyroidism and/or type II diabetes or insulin resistance.
yes, I am on medication. and I had a check on my thyroids levels also. but still not working

question: hey I am patient of  poly cystic ovarian disease andmy weight : 156.5 lbheight: 5 5"BMI :26its really hard to get rid of these extra pounds. I do 20 min walking and some light intensity aerobics but it doesn't work . I am active person but still I can't loose as much as I wanted to. suggest me some diet plans with exercises so I could loose and come down to 132 lb.
title: how to start dieting..
